pros: Culture, work/life Balance, pay and benefits, colleagues
cons: Not the most exciting work

headline: Old Mutual Financial Adviser
pros:
Great Training,
Good earning potential  
Best products in the market
cons:
A lot of pressure
Hard work

headline: Underwriter
pros: Great medical benefits, 401k match and pension.
cons: Lack of career development and advancement

headline: Massive Opportunities abound
pros: Great place to work. long-term and has massive opportunities.
cons: Legacy issues and cronyism

headline: Old Mutual plc
pros: Great Culture - Nice friendly place to work
cons: Federated business - getting Businesses to co-operate is difficult

headline: Nearing the end...
pros: Great people, great location, good pay/benefits
cons: Closing down!  Communication and treatment of remaining staff (and those that have left recently)

headline: A good place to work, but a little too safe.
pros: Friendly, polite culture. Integrity and genuineness. Some flexible working.
cons: Paternalistic and hierarchical. Culture can be conservative and slow to change.

headline: Some departments are nicer than others
pros: Big international organisation that offers potential opportunities to work overseas via internal transfer, good training ground, good pay once you reach senior management level
cons: salary below industry average before reaching senior management level; promotion is very slow and difficult

headline: looking for permanent employment. contract expired
pros: good company to work for. They look after their employees
cons: career opportunities very limited if you stand up for yourself

headline: Fixed income Analyst
pros: Provides an enabling environment for employees
cons: It is a big corporation and an individual quickly becomes statistics

headline: Area Manager
pros: Excellent Benefits, great Remuneration for dedicated work
cons: Complexity in that the Insurance Industry is growing rapidly due to Legislation

headline: Intern
pros: The management team is fantastic and all the employees really care about your development. Great place to work.
cons: A little difficult to get involved with all the teams, but you do get a lot of exposure to teams other than your own.

headline: Some of my happiest working years
pros: I felt more valued as an employee and taken care of, than I have in any of the smaller companies I worked in.
cons: Very hard to get positions because of racial preference. I was in line to get a position but I was taken off the shortlist be HR because of colour. I wasn't even allowed an interview.

headline: Solid company - let down at times by staff.
pros: Fast-paced, dynamic environment in which there was always work available for those who wanted it.
cons: Some of the staff didn't seem keen on focussing together as a team. Longer-term strategies may also benefit the company

headline: Memorable Times
pros: I enjoyed my time working in the organisation.
cons: none come to mind right now.

headline: Personal assistant
pros:
The company is stable as its a member of the Old Mutual group which is a leading multinational long-term savings, protection, investment and banking group which has been operating for 171 years.
Very customer centric.
cons:
Little collaboration between departments
Mediocrity amongst staff
Poor leadership and bureaucracy
Lower reward and benefits as compared to rest of market

headline: Good for those seeking job security and benefits
pros: A very secure job with good benefits. Lots of opportunities to move within the business.
cons: Lots of bureaucracy means difficult to be innovative. Must be willing to invest years for advancement

headline: Sr. Assoc.
pros: Great people (some very bright people), great location, generous resources
cons: Limited growth for some divisions

headline: Sr. Assoc.
pros: Great people (some very bright people), great location, generous resources
cons: Limited growth for some divisions

headline: Sad to say goodbye
pros: Strong work on the their culture and values with serious progress made in terms of Responsible Business strategy for the Group
cons: Continued uncertainty, some in-fighting and difficult structure to work within (London head office with spread out Business Units, predominantly South African business).

headline: Fund administrator
pros: Always lots of work,
cons: At times too much to do.

headline: Good learning experience. Exposure to many different aspects of the business with the excellent rotation programme.
pros:
Friendly helpful people
Many opportunities for feedback
Get to learn from some of the best
Takes growth seriously
cons:
Small niggles to cut costs
Can be more innovative with regards to how things are done rather than the sometimes just ticking boxes

headline: Great flexibility
pros: Diverse culture and very focused on ensuring staff were happy. Offers internal training and size of the company means that there is a lot of lateral growth available.
cons: Working in segregated teams meant lack of communication within the company between various departments.

headline: Actuarial Supervisor
pros: Environment, Flexibility, People, Culture, Transformation
cons: Archaic, Layers, Slow, Bureaucracy, Reactive

headline: Financial Advisor - Emerald
pros: Good experience. Cross functional
cons: Politics amongst employees. Too bureaucratic

headline: Financial Analyst
pros: Inspiring CEO, good pay, great benefits
cons: While some department may have exercised good work/life balance, the finance group didn't seem to have that mentality. Poor communication and processes with the parent company were frustrating.

headline: Old Mutual Kenya
pros: Good salary and opportunities to grow
cons: Can be bureaucratic and slow

headline: Junior Actuarial Specialist
pros:
Flexible time, experience,  easy commute.
Random functions so lots of free food.
Large variety of departments to work for in case on is tired of current department
cons: Poor remuneration of the junior actuaries.  They placed little value on work experience and promotion but more towards exams thus penalizing good work ethic indirectly

headline: FINANCIAL PLANNER
pros: Flexible, Commisions, Products, Envoir, Location
cons: Bad benefits, salaries, people without strong studies

headline: Old Mutual Kenya
pros: Great place to work - young and energetic team, good benefits and occasional opportunities to work with staff from other regions.
cons: Too much politics, an unclear performance related reward system and the lack of valuation of work experience and expertise. i.e. if you are an overachiever this isnt the place for you - more work but not more pay.

headline: DOING GREAT THINGS
pros: wonderful place, great opportunities to excel. financial giant and proper financial literacy philosophy. great achievements at your door step
cons: poor IT framework, too big to respond quickly.

headline: OM review
pros: Worked with some great people and really interesting projects.
cons: Fairly frequent turnover of senior management team.

headline: Great Company Not So Great Stafff
pros:
Company cares for staff
Lots of free stuff
Good benefits
cons:
Many staff have been there for a long time and have a poor work ethic as they are treated so well at OM.

Middle management spend too much time looking for quick wins and temporary fixes. They always choose easy option whether it is the best option or not.

headline: Business Development
pros: Excellent benefits, forward thinking firm.
cons: Very little infrastructure to support professional development.

headline: Senior Administrator
pros: One of the best companies to work for.. lots of staff benefits and bonus
cons: No downside because each place is what you make of it..

headline: OK job
pros: Okay job on the whole, reasonable hours. Possibility to take professional qualifications.
cons: Poor progression opportunities. Restrictive HR practices.

headline: fund accountant
pros: good pay, good staring place
cons: long hours, less management, the managers are very young

headline: Business Support Lead Administrator
pros: big company, Great Office, Strong Teams, good office lifestyle, enjoyable coworkers, Great locations, good career building skills, good social events
cons: hard long term career, straight to the point managers, hard to be a change maker although it is apparently encouraged,

headline: Business Support Lead Administrator
pros: big company, Great Office, Strong Teams, good office lifestyle, enjoyable coworkers, Great locations, good career building skills, good social events
cons: hard long term career, straight to the point managers, hard to be a change maker although it is apparently encouraged,

headline: Great working environment, interesting work
pros: Good work life balance, friendly environment, interesting work, company show an interest in the welfare - financial and health - of their employees.
cons: Out of date IT resources, the company does not maximise the benefits IT can bring to enhance and facilitate better communication within the company and between offices.

headline: Company review
pros: They have a good working environment that is conducive to work and good career progression.
cons: There is a high turn over of employees annually due to there unattractive compensation and remuneration packages.

headline: Old Mutual Experience
pros: Excellent atmosphere, good career projection, great people, expertise
cons: I have absolutely nothing against the company or the role, I loved the company, my boss and my team

headline: Great employment opportunity
pros: Everyone worked well together between departments
cons: Owned by international company that was managing us from overseas.

headline: Solid Company to Work For
pros: Treat employees well with competitive pay and benefits, time-off, weekly lunches, summer hours
cons: Stuffy, top-down management.  Tough to develop career if you start at a lower position.

headline: Great company, great learning experience!
pros: Got to own my work stream and work independently. Great place to learn and good work-life balance. Solid contribution to pension, retirement annuity, etc
cons: Very vertical structure - Report to a line manager, who reports to another line manager, etc.

headline: Disconnected constantly changing strategies
pros: The people were great! Very professional and experienced people in the Denver office.
cons: The constant battle between parent company and affiliates.

headline: Client Executive
pros: Everyday is different. day to day tasks vary on specific clients. Constantly building and developing  client relationships. thats what i enjoy
cons: Client reporting can be very repetative and also has to be produced to very tight deadlines. in doing this, this will ensure client relationships are maintained

headline: Long hours and no career plan plus, as a woman, got paid less than men in the same position.
pros: Lots of fun people to work around, laid back environment. You can learn a lot because of the multi tasking involved.
cons: Long hours, heavy workload not matched with the salary received, no career plan of any kind or investment in meaningful employee's training, salary below market (considering companies with same activity/scope of services)

headline: It was awesome
pros: Good working environment and culture
cons: No growth since people do not move out of the company

headline: Old Mutual Life Assurance is like an well oiled running engine, with it's wealth of experience and footprint.
pros: The flexibility and the reason that you work for your salary, if you don't put in 100% you will most probably go home with almost or no salary for that specific month
cons: The commission split between yourself and the company at times is not well balanced out.

headline: Great culture, great people.
pros: The CEO is very keen to embed culture throughout the business, and remains actively engaged with employees. The company is very supportive of organic growth and allows employees to continue their development within the firm.
cons: Management fails to communicate with teams, and as such, fails to understand true underlying issues of their teams. Most areas of the business are kept in a silo, which is counterintuitive as we depend on one another.

headline: Very developmental ito management and leadership
pros: Stable employment and it offers balanced life in terms current and future benefits
cons: Not all business units are representative of Old Mutual core values especially at senior management in Foundation Market

headline: crap
pros: well possibly the brand name
cons: the whole joint was depressing

headline: financial planning
pros: the atmosphere and the satisfaction you have a=seeing someone who becomes more financially secure
cons: The not knowing when your salary will come

headline: Not good at succession planning
pros: They offer benefits and will promote an actuary alot faster than any other role
cons: lack of personal growth and lack of direction. the business plans for the future with exculding the growth factor for their staff compliment.

headline: my role is to secure new business ,data capturing  with complience standards and work on conservation.
pros: The company has gained trust in the market  and has a strong financial background.
cons: declining of the economy caused by national strikes resulting  in lose of employment.

headline: Good in parts
pros: A diverse group with lots of opportunities in Africa
cons: Middle management is very poor and the organisation is highly siloed.

headline: I worked as a financial Advisor, Convincing clients to invest with us. It was owesome.
pros: I like it to see people happy especially after their investment mature and give them good returns.
cons: Its hard for alot of people to trust you with their money.

headline: Good Working Conditions
pros:
Good graduate trainee program. Rotation in all the divisions of the company: financial services, investments, actuarial, pension schemes, etc.

Opportunities to gain international experince with the work abroad programs.
cons:
Late hours, especially when creating quarterly reports.

Sometimes have to carry work home to beat deadlines

headline: Meh
pros: Good benefits and fair salary range.
cons: Organization is flat, very little room for advancement.

headline: A relaxed but productive workplace.
pros: A relaxed atmosphere in a truly great location (London HQ), OM could be a company that you work at for a long time.
cons: Perhaps some of the vision is and direction is being missed. Subsidiary group companies seem able to 'wag the dog' in certain regards.

headline: We do great things!
pros: People - customers and employees - are put first.
cons: There are none that I have experienced so far.

headline: Old Mutual Group Head Office
pros: Some great people across this multinational group
cons: Some senior people that don't live the Group's values

headline: A company with strong corporate values that is increasing its presence in the UK
pros: Management and culture thrives to empower employees. Currently there is a drive to change through transformation post a series of M&A activity in the UK - which makes it a really interesting place to work. Overall there is a positive culture to those who want to work with the organisation on the journey to making Old Mutual a big name in UK FS.  There has recently been influx of great talent into the business.
cons: The organisation is going through a great deal of change post mergers and acquisitions in the UK space, this means that both BAU and central services are stretched.  Therefore i could only recommend to those that enjoy change.

headline: Intermediate Actuarial Specialist at Old Mutual
pros: Great job satisfaction, great people, great rotation policy.
cons: Lots of red tape at times.

headline: Old Faithful
pros:
very good support
quick turn around
minimal paperwork
the support from the home office on the mainland was great!
cons:
beat the street
pound the pavement
find your own leads
their was no real mentor close to me and the time difference proved to be a hindrance when scheduling

headline: The Borg Outpost
pros: Many nice people â€“ especially the more recent joiners
cons:
ClichÃ©s and fiefdoms connected by their length of service, rather than value, competency or effectiveness.

Decision making by committee or collective â€“ no one wants to be accountable for a decision.

headline: salary
pros: no limit to earning potential
cons: Hard work and dedication is a must

headline: salary
pros: no limit to earning potential
cons: Hard work and dedication is a must

headline: Truly best Employer in SA, Old Mutual PFA
pros: Considerate to employees whilst at the same time driving hard for better delivery of results. To so, Old Mutual PFA is constantly developing it's people.
cons: Many departments with each their requirements and systems not completely integrated into one cohesive unit, impacting on system advancement and cutting edge technology usage

headline: Draining
pros: People are generally nice, HR team really tries to make the workplace fun with team building exercises, lunches, etc.
cons: Management does not listen to employees, creativity in problem solving is actively discouraged, work/life balance is minimal in some groups, management team is shaky and worst of all, London office controls everything making for lots of bureaucratic unnecessary paper-pushing jobs.

headline: Fun place to work
pros: A good place to learn
cons: No career future.  It is a closed block business.

headline: A leaderless company that doesn't have a vision or know to manage itself in advance of problems.
pros: Being employed is better than being unemployed.  Responsibilities are delegated, and compensation was fair.  The company does maintain a strong balance sheet.
cons: The failure of leadership means your job is at high risk of developing into a past position as they lay people off to compensate for their failures.

headline: my experience at old mutual was good.
pros: some of the best reasons to work for Old Mutual is the salary and bonuses.
cons: some of the downsides is limited flex time.

headline: Not great but good
pros:
Good place to work day to day
Helpful colleagues and no back stabbing
Opportunities for growth - You work and you grow
cons:
Wish management was more helpful
Very busy but very competent leadership team
Want more vacation time
Want more team building acts

headline: Great Experience
pros: The staff at Old Mutual US is wonderful; everyone is very welcoming and they know how to balance work and play.
cons: There aren't very many downsides to Old Mutual, however communication can be improved between senior management and the other employees.

headline: Co-workers are great ,nice casual atmosphere
pros: Employees are allowed to work from home.  Great access to training for employees.
cons: Favortism, lack of team work within 1 group.

headline: Go away with this company
pros: The benefit is good, the management try to give more benefits to keep the employee. Good point on the resume.
cons: Very bad management, the turnover rate is very high, every employee will be feel upset with something. Do not be the employee of this company.
